segments.en: Linked Discourses 54
1. One Thing
6. With Ariṭṭha
At Sāvatthī.
There the Buddha … said:
“Mendicants, do you develop mindfulness of breathing?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā ariṭṭho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Venerable Ariṭṭha said to him:
“Sir, I develop mindfulness of breathing.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, ariṭṭha, bhāvesi ānāpānassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Atītesu me, bhante, kāmesu kāmacchando pahīno, anāgatesu me kāmesu kāmacchando vigato, ajjhattabahiddhā ca me dhammesu paṭighasaññā suppaṭivinītā.
segments.en: “Sir, I’ve given up desire for sensual pleasures of the past. I’m rid of desire for sensual pleasures of the future. And I have eliminated perception of repulsion regarding phenomena internally and externally.
Just mindful, I will breathe in. Mindful, I will breathe out.
That’s how I develop mindfulness of breathing.”
“That is mindfulness of breathing, Ariṭṭha; I don’t deny it.

segments.pli: Api ca, ariṭṭha, yathā ānāpānassati vitthārena paripuṇṇā hoti
segments.en: But as to how mindfulness of breathing is fulfilled in detail,

segments.pli: taṃ suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ariṭṭho bhagavato paccassosi.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” Ariṭṭha replied.
The Buddha said this:
“And how is mindfulness of breathing fulfilled in detail?

segments.pli: Idha, ariṭṭha, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.
Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out.

segments.pli: Dīghaṃ vā assasanto ‘dīghaṃ assasāmī’ti pajānāti … pe …
segments.en: When breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’ When breathing out heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing out heavily.’ …
They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, ariṭṭha, ānāpānassati vitthārena paripuṇṇā hotī”ti.
segments.en: This is how mindfulness of breathing is fulfilled in detail.”

suttaplex.blurb: When the Buddha asks Venerable Ariṭṭha about breath meditation, his answer, while not incorrect, does not do full justice to the practice.
